definition: to pick (flowers)/to pinch/to nip/to pinch off/to clutch/(slang) to fight
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: As he crumples the flowering end of the weed in his hand, Nelson grimaces.
sentences.chinese: 尼尔森苦笑着掐断手中杂草的花，把杂草弄死。

sentences.english: Cutting the fibre-optic cables that connect a country to the world, for example, might seem easy.
sentences.chinese: 例如，将连接到国外的光纤掐断看起来很简单。

definition: to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to cut off/to chop sth in half
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
to block (a road)/to plug (a hole)/to stop up
escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
to cut short/to break off/to discontinue/to interrupt
